newsitem.title: USA: Natgas futures hold late short covering gains.
newsitem.headline: Natgas futures hold late short covering gains.

text.p: NYMEX Henry Hub natgas futures were still holding gains in moderate, late-session trade, boosted by more pre-weekend short covering amid concerns about Tropical Storm Edouard, industry sources said.
At 1405 EDT, September climbed 3.9 cents to $1.96 per million British thermal units after hitting $1.90 on ACCESS. October was 5.1 cents higher at $2.05. Others also were up.
"We're still seeing short covering ahead of the weekend because of Edouard," said one Houston-based trader.
At 1100 EDT, Edouard was 1,500 miles east of the Lesser Antilles, moving west at 15 mph with winds of about 70 mph.
But most expected the gains to be short-lived, noting that mild weather next week in the Midwest and Northeast was likely to set a bearish tone during bidweek.
With September set to expire Monday, technical traders remained focused on October, still pegging support at Thursday's low of $1.975 and resistance in the low-teens.
U.S. Gulf Coast weekend cash prices slipped another five cents Friday to the low-to-mid $1.90s. Midcon pipes were down a similar amount to the mid-$1.70s.

NYMEX said 19,448 Henry Hub contracts traded at 1330 EDT. NYMEX September Permian natgas firmed 2.5 cents to $1.695, while deferreds were untraded at 1410 EDT. NYMEX said 39 Permian contracts traded at 1330 EDT.
NYMEX September Permian natgas futures expire Wednesday August 28.
On the KCBT, September was still unchanged at $1.77, while deferreds were steady to up 1.5 cents. The East/West spread widened by 3.9 cents to 19 cents (NYMEX premium).
KCBT September natgas futures expire Tuesday, August 27.
